title: amazon delivery driver claims told
story: Amazon delivery driver claims he was told to finish sht despite chest painsBoth Amazon and the independent provider through which Neil was employed said they were looking into the issue after he claimed he suffered symptoms of a heart attack on shtNeil Martin is a delivery driver Image: Colin Lane Liverpool EchoByJonathan HumphriesGraeme Murray:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |comments A driver delivering Amazon parcels claims he was told to finish his sht by an agency after suffering symptoms which led to a heart attack.Neil Martin began having pains in his chest, had cold sweats and felt dizzy while driving his van.The -year-old had began his day by picking up packages at the Amazon depot and started his deliveries in Wigan, Liverpool Echo reports.Neil from Prescot, Merseyside, who is subcontracted to Amazon via an agency called Deva Logistics, went to hospital to get checked out. But after contacting the Deva office and receiving no answer, he sent a text message explaining the situation he was facing. The message said: Mate can you call me, am getting chest pains and keep going dizzy am gonna have to go and get checked out.  I started getting pains in my chest, feeling dizzy and I was getting sweaty. I ignored it for a minute or two but I started thinking no, this does not feel right. So I pulled over and phoned the office, but it rang out, so I texted the work mobile number that I was getting chest pains and the manager rang me back. I askedsomeone could come and get my packages because I wanted to go to the hospital. They told me someone could come and take half my route off me but that they couldnapost do any more than that. A spokesman for Deva said the company sent a driver to assist and believed Neil had been relieved of all his packages - a claim which Neil strongly refutes. Instead said he felt he had no option but to carry on with the route. Neil said: I didnapost realise how serious it was at the time. But it went on right through the afternoon, just getting worse and worse.  The dizzy spells were so bad I kept having to pull over because I couldnapost see anything. Despite his worrying symptoms Neil ploughed on with his sht and dropped the van back at the depot at around .pm, hours after the symptoms began. He said: When I got back to the depot my manager asked meI was alright to work tomorrow and said he had a smaller route over the water I can go on. I said I need to go to hospital first before I start thinking about packages. He ed home and went straight to AE at Whiston Hospital with his we, Susan Martin. Doctors quickly established something was seriously wrong, and Neil says his heart rate was around  beats per minute rather than the usual . Neil was kept in as an inpatient for the next  days, where he underwent extensive testing including an angiogram and was given medication to keep his heart rate under control. After being stabilised he was transferred to Liverpool Heart and Chest Hospital for an MRI scan before being allowed home to recuperate. Neil said: The doctors told me I had already had a heart attack and asked me why I had waited so long before coming in. I was disgusted. It made me feel like delivering packages was more important than my health. I am not blaming them for me having a heart attack, but I feel like I could have died on that road and they didnapost care. A spokesman for Deva said: We take the safety of the independent, self-employed contractors we engage with, very seriously, and we are still investigating how the incident was handled. As soon as we learned Neil was unwell, one of our four standby contractors was sent to relieve him of the load and as far as we were concerned Neil had received the support that he had requested. We were not aware that Neil had been left with packages. Had we been aware we would have immediately sent another driver to relieve him. We have people on standby specically to cover routes which need support at short notice, including a driver needing to finish early, illness or in the case of traffic issues or vehicle breakdown. A couple of days later our site manager texted Neil to see how he was. Neil explained what was happening, thanked the manager and a thumbs up emoji for getting in touch and would keep him informed on his progress. A spokesman for Amazon said: “Safety is a top priority and we wish the delivery driver a speedy recovery. We have launched an immediate investigation with the delivery service provider who engages the driver.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Amazon" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news archies-surname-caused-huge-rt-"Meghan Markle says Archie ‘loves being a big brother’ in ByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |commentsBeing a senior member of the royal family means you get all sorts of fancy titles, including HRH, dukedoms and honorary ranks. But the Queenaposs relatives who are further down the line of succession donapost have this privilege, which means they have to use a normal surname like the rest of us. So while Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis use their parentsapos aposCambridgeapos title as their surname at school, their cousins Archie and Lilibet use the royal familyaposs aposofficialapos last name - Mountbatten-Windsor. The moniker combines the royal name, Windsor, with Prince Philipaposs surname, Mountbatten. However the name caused a massive row in the royal family and was even raised in the Houses of Parliament, resulting in a rt between the Queen and her husband.  It didnapost appear on an official document until , but the complicated story behind the name dates all the way back to .Before marrying The Queen and becoming the Duke of Edinburgh, Philipaposs official title was Prince Philip of Greece and Denmark of the House of Schleswig-Holstein-Sonderburg-Glücksburg.However, his name wasnapost considered to be neutral enough so he adopted the name Mountbatten after his grandparents. When the then Princess Elizabeth had the coupleaposs first child, Prince Charles, in , he assumed, due to tradition, that their little one would take his name.  However, when Elizabeth went on to become Queen in , she had to confirm the official surname of the Royal Family and many wanted her to continue using Windsor, instead of changing it to Mountbatten. Winston Churchill is said to have been an advocate for the Royals using the name Windsor and The Queenaposs grandmother, Queen Mary, agreed.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here. It is said to have caused such an issue that the matter was even discussed in Parliament. In the end, the Queen decided to support her familyaposs views and the name Windsor was used.At the time, Philip reportedly said: I am nothing but a bloody amoeba. I am the only man in the country not allowed to give his name to his own children.The topic continued to bother him for years to come, but it wasnapost until  that Elizabeth decided to do something more about it. When the couple fell pregnant with their third child, Elizabeth was Queen and Philip was still keen for his children to have his surname. So in , Her Majesty is said to have gone to see Harold Macmillan, who had then taken over as PM. She said she absolutely needed to revisit the issue and admitted it had been irritating her husband since . Finally, a comprise was met, and on February ,  -  days before Prince Andrew was born - the Queen declared that she had adopted the name Mountbatten-Windsor. She announced that it would be used by all her descendants who do not enjoy the title of His or Her Royal Highness. And as we have seen, itaposs still used today. A statement on the Royal website explains: The Royal Family name of Windsor was confirmed by The Queen after her accession in . However, in , The Queen and The Duke of Edinburgh decided that they would like their own direct descendants to be distinguished from the rest of the Royal Family , as Windsor is the surname used by all the male and unmarried female descendants of George V. It was therefore declared in the Privy Council that The Queenaposs descendants, other than those with the style of Royal Highness and the title of Prince Princess, or female descendants who marry, would carry the name of Mountbatten-Windsor. news uk-news asda-tesco-iceland-issue-urgent-"Food recalls arent that common says expert in ByLottie Gibbons:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |comments Several supermarkets have issued urgent warnings as products are pulled from shelves. Customers are being urged to check their kitchens in case they have any unsafe products on the go, reports the Liverpool Echo.It comes after Kinder products became under threat of contamination from Salmonella, forcing a factory in Belgium to close after over  people came down with the bug. Other products have been found to contain high levels of E. coli. Asda, Tesco, Morrisons are among the supermarket giants to have recalled items in recent weeks, with consumers told tothem to the store for a full refund.You do not need to have your receipt to get your money back. When a product is recalled, for any reason, the Food Safety Agencyshares details on what you should doyou have bought the item, as well as detailed information on why the product is being pulled from shelves.  Ferrero is extending their precautionary action of recalling additional Kinder products because they might be contaminated with Salmonella. This is an update to include additional Kinder products and best before dates. Product details Kinder SurprisePack size:  g and  g x  Best-before dates: all dates up to and including  October Kinder SurprisePack size:  g Best-before dates: all dates from  April  up to and including  August Kinder Mini EggsPack size:  g Best-before dates: all dates from  April  up to and including  August Kinder Egg Hunt KitPack size:  g Best-before dates: all dates from  April  up to and including  August Kinder SchokobonsPack size:  g Best-before dates: all dates from  April  up to and including  August Symptoms caused by Salmonella usually include fever, diarrhoea and abdominal cramps.If you have bought the above products do not eat them. Instead, please contact the Ferrero consumer careline on consumers.uk@ferrero or    UK or +    Ireland to obtain a full refund.Tesco  As a precaution, Trewithen Dairy is recalling one batch code of its unsalted butter, as it’s been found to contain high levels of E. coli.Trewithen Dairy Unsalted Butter G Best before date:  May  Batch code: G No other Trewithen Dairy products are known to be affected. If you’ve bought an affected product, please don’t eat it. Instead,it to a Tesco store where a full refund will be given. No receipt is required. For more information, you can contact Trewithen Dairy Customer Services on   . Iceland Iceland is recalling Iceland Takeaway Chicken Bhunabecause it contains milk which is not declared on the label. As a result of a packaging error, some packs may contain Iceland Takeaway Creamy Butter Chicken. This means the product is a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents. Product details Iceland Takeaway Chicken BhunaPack size:  g Batch code: L Best-before date:  January  Allergen: milkIf you have bought the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents do not eat it. Insteadit to the store from where it was bought for a full refund. If you have any questions or concerns, you can contact Iceland customer care telephone line on   . title: brave woman shares trauma being
story: Brave woman shares trauma of being forced to have sex with  men a day by gangNataliehas bravely spoken about the "most traumatic time" when she was trafficked into the UK, taken by a gang and locked in a room, tasered, and forced to have threesomes was kidnapped from a Welsh city and trafficked to three cities in England as a sex worker." content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _GMP_WOL_Sex_worker_JPG.jpg" width"" "" Natalie: It was terrying, especially the traumaImage: WalesOnline  Gayle MarshByMatt StrudwickLiz Perkins:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr  has bravely spoken about the most traumatic time when she was trafficked into the UK, taken by a gang and locked in a room, tasered, and forced to have threesomes" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _GMP_WOL_Sex_worker_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"facebook|share|top" has bravely spoken about the most traumatic time when she was trafficked into the UK, taken by a gang and locked in a room, tasered, and forced to have threesomes" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _GMP_WOL_Sex_worker_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top" has bravely spoken about the most traumatic time when she was trafficked into the UK, taken by a gang and locked in a room, tasered, and forced to have threesomes" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _GMP_WOL_Sex_worker_JPG.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"Natalie was just aged  when she was kidnapped by a gang, tied up, and locked away in a room. Trafficked into the UK, she was tasered and forced to have threesomes, gang bangs, and sleep with  men a night. “It was the most traumatic time of my le, she says. Her horric ordeal left her with addictions to drugs and sex after she was farmed around dferent cities as her home was turned into a drugs hub.Natalie, who is going under a dferent name, said she would be lucky to get two hours’ sleep a night and wouldn’t see a penny from her sex work that she carried out over  months in dferent cities across the UK, reports WalesOnline. I had tasers to me, she says, At the time I did not realise how bad it actually was. It was a gang who kidnapped me and held me captive. I was stuck in my bedroom with a lock on the door and they took over my house. I was not there for  months and it was like a drugs hub, I was not sure what was going on.”  A victim of child abuse had made her vulnerable and she says she was naive as to how the gang had operated, who had been operating in Wales for two decades, Natalie says. She adds: “I was taken to Liverpool, that was probably the scariest time. That was the first time I was tied up. If I had spoken out I would have been killed and I thought my daughter would have it, it was mad.” At the time, Natalie admits she was a cocaine addict which left her in their debt and under their control. She continues: “They had seen the amount of money I was spending on cocaine - I was a coke addict. I was buying coke off them. It’s how I became involved in all of it.. I was sold to the sex trade.... I needed someone to find me.” As she was trafficked across Britain she barely slept to keep up with the demands of her kidnappers. The horror of being raped and abused is one she was familiar with. “Sometimes I would have sex  or  times a day all day,” she says. “I would only have two hours’ sleep a day and not even that. Me and my associate would be made to do stuff together and made more money. I would have to have threesomes and gang bangs. It was terrying, especially the trauma.”  She adds: “I was there for  months, that was not just in that one city it was everywhere. It was not in one place. I was in Liverpool for six weeks, I was not allowed out, I was in a room. I think I went to the south of the country after that - it was not as bad. “Obviously, it’s bad but I didn’t have tasers to me - it wasn’t as damaging there. I was there .for about four months, it was a normal house. London and Liverpool was the scariest one. London was bad - it was worst than the city in the south. I was in London for about six months, all I would do is work. In the whole time I didn’t sleep in any way and I couldn’t really sleep. After I had been gone for four months I never thought anyone would find me. Natalie has since been able to turn her le around, but the emotional scars remain and she still lives in fear. It was only on herto Wales that the brutal reality of her existence was finally uncovered but it was a struggle to speak out and reveal what had happened to her. The challenge now is living with the fear the crime gang remain at large. Natalie, now , said she was worried she would be discovered. “They didn’t jail them they are still out there,” she says. “They have been arrested but no jail sentence has been given for it. I get scared they may find me, I am petried. Now I just feelthey wanted to find me they probably would. I think I have moved on even to do with sex work, all that has all stopped. It’s because I had a sex addiction and I have seen love as through sex. aposFor me to be proud of myself is a thingapos Her le since her abduction has not been easy. She has endured spells of homelessness and drug abuse and found it dficult to maintain relationships. She ed to sex work on the streets when she did not know what  to do, although she says she has not done sex work for two years now. She has had four children, none of whom are in her care. Yet she says she has beaten her addictions to cocaine and crack cocaine and now only smokes weed. Her addiction to sex has been tougher to break and is something she still wrestles with.Natalie says: “My sex addiction was hard to overcome, I was working with BAWSO [an organisation that provides emotional support to black minority ethnic and migrant victims of domestic abuse, sexual violence, human trafficking]- I had  sessions and four extra sessions so I had a total of  hours support to help me,” she says. “I had to retrain my brain.I was working with a support group and I ended up working with one of the workers. She helped me a lot with my sex addiction -I do not have sex for two weeks I am fine. It’s breaking the cycle of not wanting it all of the time. She says she is now focused on her children and has been through three years of intensive support thanks to Safer Wales, which offers support to those who are invisible in society and work to protect victims of sexual exploitation from danger. Without them the woman would not have been able to move on into a dferent le and have a roof over her head. Her plan is to build a brighter future for not just herself but others who have struggled through their teens. “My Safer Wales worker has been there for tears and laughter, she has been through my three-year journey,” she said. “For me to be proud of myself is a thing - I was never proud before, now I could not be happier. “Two weeks ago I was given my flat - it’s all guns going with all the decorating. I think of the now, I try to bury everything - I shouldn’t but I do. I want to go to uni and do health and social care and open a rehab from  to -year-olds, I want to help people who have gone through dficult times when they are going through adolescence and offer a better start in the care system.” Natalie adds: “If I had a better start in le I would not have got into a situation of drugs and the trafficking. I never thought I was going to survive - it was like my world had ended and I was a no one.” Read MoreRead More Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON ProstitutionCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: british gas customer claims faulty
story: Exclusive: British Gas customer claims faulty smart meter can show up to £, a dayFrustrated customers have been speaking to The Mirror about their British Gas meters not working, showing larger than usual readings, having to keep the heating off amid cold temperaturesCustomer Jamie Watkinson-Harveywith his husband Lewis Watkinson-Harvey Image: Jamie Watkinson-HarveyByDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |commentsBritish Gas customers say they worry about keeping their children warm with faulty smart meters that appear to show extortionate daily readings.Complaints have been flooding the energy provideraposs online forums with unsubstantiated claims of overcharging and the app not working correctly since February, at a time where families are already anxious about the cost of living crisis.Frustrated customers have been speaking to The Mirror about their British Gas meters not working, showing large readings, having to keep the heating off amid cold temperatures and being unable to get their issues fixed quickly.Jamie Watkinson-Harvey described British Gas smart meters as simply not fit for purpose and claimed one meter showed he was using £, per day. Have you experienced any issues  Email webnews@mirror  Ours has never worked since we moved into our new home in September , he told The Mirror. Their actual meters have been faulty and my husband and I were successful in an ombudsman complaint for service failures during the meter issue. However, one thing BG have not got right is the internal smart meter that remains unfixed. Since September we are on our th smart meter. That is a low conservative guess.The smart meter fails to demonstrate correct usage.  One model said I was using £, per day in electric. The app only has electric data for February  and  now and I genuinely do not know how they intend to recty.As a result of a faulty meter we have been unable to adjust any of our energy habits since moving into our new property. He shared a photo of a day he said the meter showed £. Another customer, who wished to stay anonymous, told The Mirror: Both my gas and electric are supplied by British Gas. My smart meter stopped working as of the March . Unfortunately no engineer available until the July .  Not a happy customer, the worst is trying to speak to anyone. He added: The smart meter is showing all zeros and not actually recording any details whatsoever, a spokesman from British Gas acknowledged they are not receiving any information either. I am aged  and am down as urgent on receiving help under British Gas terms and conditions. I find  weeks too long to resolve the situation. Charlotte, who described herself as a disgruntled customer, told us: I too have experienced this issue since February. I have tried to speak to BG with no success, finally resulting to an online chat that was a waste of time. Like your other readers suggest something fishy is going on and as a customer that used the BG app daily to check consumption I am concerned that my current direct payment will be incorrect. Our Cost of Living team of experts are here to help YOU through a very dficult year. Theyaposll be bringing you the latest money news stories and also providing specialist advice. Whether itaposs rocketing energy bills, the cost of the weekly shop or increased taxes, our team will be with you all the way. Every Thursday at pm they will take part in a Facebook Live event to answer your questions and offer their advice. Visit facebook dailymirror live to watch. You canabout our team of experts here. If you have a question - or want to share your story - please get in touch by emailing webnews@mirror.Like other households I am trying to limit my usage but without the daily meter reading there is no way of gatekeeping is, suggesting that BG are doing this to benefit themselves rather than be open and transparent. I hope my inidual story will help with highlighting the underhand actions of one of our fuel giants and the way that they are treating their loyal customers at a time of increased anxiety. A mum said: Our smart meter now by am reads over £. and we haven’t even used any electric or gas yet today- well be it minimal as we have actually got up.By the end of today it will show nearly £. - this is minimal use and no use of a washing machine or tumble drier.It’s shocking I have no idea how we will afford to keep our children warm by this winter at the price we seem to be being charged. Another claims she was told her smart meter is faulty and they need an engineer but said there are no appointments available.The Mirror has contacted British Gas for comment.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON British GasCost of Living: Were Here to Help" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news british-gas-customers-claim-something-"Smart meter change that could reduce household energy billsByMatthew EvansRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Apr |comments British Gas customers claim something fishy is going on with their smart meters amid the cost of living crisis.Complaints have been flooding the energy and home service provideraposs online forums with unsubstantiated claims of overcharging, and the app not working correctly since February.It comes as energy prices began to soar this year as a result of the Covid pandemic, as well as Ukraine invasion and ongoing Brexit aftermath. And Brits have been united in their despair, reports NorthWalesLive. National Insurance, council tax, and food and fuel prices have all increased due to the crisis, and experts have warned that the spikes wonapost start slowing anytime soon. Those that use smart meters were all under the impression that this would help keep cost down and also under control, as it helps monitor the bills. Unfortunately, customers of British Gas have come out in their droves complaining about something fishy going on.Love was certainly not lost on aposThe British Gas complaints pageapos Facebook page. Have you been experiencing similar problems  Let us know at webnews@mirror Sharon Backhouse said: How the hell can BG charge me £ in  minutes when I have no heating on  Amy Evans warned: Keep a close eye on your accounts. After querying what the cost says on my smart meter I was then told this was correct. £ electricity in  days! Again queried this suddenly it went down and after further query went down again. Something fishy going on! Julie Rose brought up the issues of home discounts. She said: Still not got home discount. Iaposve got a  year old in house with a coat on and hot water bottle and blanket. Our Cost of Living team of experts are here to help YOU through a very dficult year. Theyaposll be bringing you the latest money news stories and also providing specialist advice. Whether itaposs rocketing energy bills, the cost of the weekly shop or increased taxes, our team will be with you all the way. Every Thursday at pm they will take part in a Facebook Live event to answer your questions and offer their advice. Visit facebook dailymirror live to watch. You canabout our team of experts here. If you have a question - or want to share your story - please get in touch by emailing webnews@mirror. Iaposve explained this to BG and said they canapost tell me when it will be sent out to me and they can see Iaposm entitled to it but canapost even put it on my meter at there end. Are they having a laugh  Fuming not the word. In response, Charlene Borsberry said: Told me I didnapost even apply for it but why am I surprised [after] they stole last yearaposs from me  Iaposve had  years of dealing with them constantly cutting us off or letting us down. I have  children, one who needs medical equipment. They know all this. They just donapost care...as long as the big wigs are sitting pretty. Iaposm done, Iaposve started the switch. Canapost handle the stress. Disgusting company!  Anne OaposShiel apparently managed to get through to British Gas, who gave a date for customers expecting payments. She posted: Finally spoke to BG re my Warm Home Discount. I was informed that everyone should receive their payments by th April. If nothing has been received by then, to call back  only then, can they make payment, directly to the meter...! Nicky Hitchcock was equally outraged about the apparent overcharging. She said: We were on a fixed tarf of £ per month, which ended in December.  They then put us up to £ per month and have now recommend we pay  PER MONTH, even though we’ve never been in debit! Three bedroom semi-detached, not a mansion! We now only use the boiler for  hour each morning to provide some hot water for the day and then wrap up in thermals for the rest of our time in the house! What do British Gas say  NorthWalesLive has reached out to British Gas for a response to these claims. From their help page they found the following: If your meter isnapost workingIf your pay as you go meter is damaged, we can send someone out to make sure you and your property are safe. Just call us on our as you go enquiries line.This line is open Monday to Friday am to pm for general enquiries and  hours a day, seven days a week for emergencies. If you donapost have a pay as you go meter please call us on our Account enquiries line. Whatmy meteraposs damaged If thereaposs something wrong with your gas meter, thataposs worrying. Immediately get in touch with the Gas Emergency Services. If you notice any sparking, smoking or burning coming from your meter, ring the fire brigade. Turn off all your appliances and call your local electricity distributor.Whatmy meter reading hasnapost changed, or is going backwards Your meter may be recording your energy use incorrectly. If you have a pay as you go meter call us on our Pay as you go enquiries line as soon as possible to make sure youaposre only paying for what youaposve used. If you donapost have a pay as you go meter call us on our Account enquiries line Why has my smart meter stopped working We need to establishthe problem is with your smart meters or your smart energy monitor. Follow this link here to checkthe problem could be with your smart energy monitor. If this hasn’t resolved the issue, occasionally there are problems with the technology that supports smart meters. We investigate any issues on a case by case basis work out what we can do to help you. title: devastated mum shares grief teenage
story: Devastated mum shares her grief as teenage daughter is found hanged at homeChloe Barber, of Drfield, East Yorkshire, was bullied at school, self-harmed and eventually took her own le at home in November last year. Her mum has shared her grief, pictured with her daughter, told of her heartbreak" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Teenagers-younger-brother-found-her-hanged-after-coming-form-school.jpg" width"" "" Kirsten Barber , pictured with her daughter, told of her heartbreak Image: HullLiveBySusie Beevers:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr A devastated mother has shared her grief after her teenage daughter was found hanged at the family home.Kirsten Barber said Chloe Barber, , fell through the cracks of the mental health system after several stays in psychiatric hospitals.Her brother Reece Barber, , discovered Chloe unresponsive and, though her called  and gave Chloe CPR, the teenager was pronounced dead at the home in Drfield, East Yorkshire. Speaking today, grief-stricken Kirsten said Chloe struggled after being diagnosed with unstable personality disorder.She told Hull Live : You know when people say they’re heartbroken  This is heartbroken.When you split up with your boyfriend and stuff like that you think you know heartbreak. But this is heartbreak. Anyone who is able to can donate to Kirstenaposs JustGiving page for their Three Peaks challenge for Chloe here.  There are times when I just want to tell Chloe something, like when our dogs have done something daft and then you remember you can’t. But I know she’s still here. I had Covid last month and the worst thing about it was losing my sense of smell. I went into her bedroom because I just go in there every so often to be near her, and I couldn’t smell her. The family had first noticed signs Chloe was struggling in  when she was a victim of bullying at school. She also self-harmed as her condition deteriorated over the following years. On one occasion, Chloe didnapostto Mill Lodge Hospital in York after going for a walk. And in early , the teenager was hospitalised at Cygnet Health Care where her problems with self harm became worse. It was at Cygnet where she also met friend Cha Blue Mooney, a teenager from Bridlington, North Yorkshire, who shortly later died while in the unitaposs care. Chloe was left devastated by -year-old Cha’s death in April last year.  Kirsten continued: Mental health is an invisible killer. If someone’s got cancer or a broken leg you can physically see it and you can physically mend it. We still don’t know exactly what Chloe was going through. She was a very secretive person. Chloe took her own le in November last year. Kirsten is taking on the Yorkshire Three Peaks later this spring to raise cash for young suicide charity Papyrus. Figures released by the Office of National Statisticsthis week show  people in Yorkshire  the Humber took their lives in  - of which  were men or boys and  women or girls. Data suggests suicide figures did not rise during the pandemic, although have slowly risen over the past  years. And while suicide remains the biggest killer of young men, the number of female suicides has been insidiously creeping up in recent years. Papyrus supports young people affected by suicide and suicidal thoughts, and has seen a % increase in calls, texts and emails to its confidential HOPELINEUK service. In  and  at least one in every three contacts was from a child under the age of .Anyone who is able to can donate to Kirstenaposs JustGiving page for their Three Peaks challenge for Chloe here. A spokesperson from Humber Teaching NHS Foundation Trust, said:“It is the position of the Trust that we do not comment on inidual cases, as we prefer to discuss directly with the families who are affected.” The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. title: hero holds dying dads hand
story: Hero holds dying dads hand and tells him his daughter is safe after horror crashHGV technician Steve Wroe, , joined a group of heroic rescuers who saved a teenage girls le after a lorry and car collided on the M near Goole, in the East Riding of YorkshireTwo men were killed after a HGV and car crashed on the M near Goole Image: MEN MEDIAByEmily JohnsonRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Apr |comments A heroic passing motorist who fought desperately to save the victims of a horror crash said he held the hand of a dying driver and told him his daughter was safe.Steve Wroe embarked on the daring rescue alongside other witnesses after spotting the carnage on the M which saw two men die.The -year-old said he wanted one of the fatalitiesapos families to know he was aware his daughter was safe when he passed away, reports Hull Live.A HGV and a car had collided on the motorway near Goole, in the East Riding of Yorkshire, at around .am last Wednesday.According to the latest reports from Humberside Police, a -year-old girl remains in hospital. Steve, from Huddersfield, said he and a group of men battled to save the girl, who had been travelling in the HGV, which had set on fire. Have you been affected by this story  Let us know at webnews@mirror The Good Samaritan described how, despite his best efforts, he was unable to free the lorryaposs -year-old driver. Instead, Steve held his hand and was not willing to leave his side as he succumbed to his injuries. Fighting back tears, he said: I tried my hardest and I feel like Iaposve failed the family because I couldnapost do more. I just really need his family to know that the last words he heard were that we saved his daughter and she was safe. I had hold of his hand and kept telling him I was sorry, right until his final moments.  After seeing the accident ahead, Steve said he ran down the slip road and set out to rescue those involved. He was joined by three other men who were attempting to force open the damaged door of the HGV involved and smashed the passenger window. Steve has decades of experience as a HGV technician, and directed the men to focus on freeing the teenager from the vehicle, while he turned his attention on the man in the driveraposs seat. They attempted to use a fire extinguisher to put out the flames but it was not holding them back. Steve held the manaposs hand as it became clear he was unable to be rescued.It reached a point where I told him that I had to go and he passed in a matter of seconds afterwards. He wasnapost suffering for a long time and we made sure to stay with him as long as possible. The only other option would have been to get in the cabin with him, but there was just so much fire and smoke. He continued: It wasnapost safe to do anything more and I had to think about my own family in that moment as well. Steve described the other rescuers as  out of  and true heroes. I can only hope the girl is doing okay, he added. A -year-old man, who was driving the car involved in the accident, also died in the crash on April . Steveaposs boss Oliver North picked him up from the hospital in the aftermath and said his work kit was completely charred and his face was still covered in soot. He said: Steve was coughing and choking, heaposd been on oxygen for two hours after the incident. We think he is an absolute hero and a truly unbelievable man. The thing is, Steve would never have usually been down that way as he is mainly based in Brighouse.He added that his firm is building ambulances for Ukraine, and Steve was driving parts down to its Goole factory.He is so passionate about saving lives that he wanted to get involved in the project in any way he could, thataposs just who he is, continued Oliver. It is no surprise that he didnapost hesitate to run down that slip road and do all he could to help those victims. Steve is set toto work on Monday at his own request but has been given a present by his colleagues. title: inside incredibly cheap three bedroom
story: Inside incredibly cheap three-bedroom house with guide price of just £,Property buyers keen to take on a housing project which might need a little love and care could pick themselves up a bargain at the auction saleThe property is on the market at £, Image: ZooplaByFaith PringGraeme Murray:,  Apr |commentsA property promises to give one lucky house buyer a leg up on to the housing ladder. And for those trying to buy for the first time, it can sometimes seem impossible. In the current climate, with a cost of living crisis stretching people further, it can feel like the cost of everything is going up. Every penny is being made to stretch further and nowhere is this more noticeable than among potential first-time home buyers looking to get a start on the housing ladder.But DerbyshireLive reports not all homes have to cost a fortune and there are certainly some bargains to be had in some areas. Anyone who is keen to take on a housing project which might need a little love and care could pick themselves up a bargain. Currently listed on Zoopla is this bargain three-bedroomed semi-detached house in Ripley, Derbyshire. It has a guide price of just £, which is a strong start for anyone looking to buy their first home and get a leg-up the ladder.  While the interior and exterior leave a little to be desired, the price is not something to be laughed at. £, could see you own three bedrooms, two reception rooms and a bathroom, all of which may be in need of updating. Being sold on a freehold basis, the home is located in a residential area with a two-storey extension at the back of the property.  The estate agent also believes there is space for further extension to the property, subject to planning approval. Zoopla said of the property: “A unique freehold three bedroom semi-detached property located in a quiet residential area of Ripley. The property has had a two storey extension added to the rear and briefly comprises of: Entrance hallway, one large through lounge, kitchen, utility room, three well proportioned bedrooms.  The online estate agent adds that the property has an upstairs family bathroom, a large turfed paved rear garden with the added benefit of two additional out-buildings as well as three stables. A schedule continues: “The property also has a block paved driveway to the front and would make an excellent investment or owner occupier and could potentially be suitable for a further extension. .”  The home will go under the hammer in an online auction on April  at pm and will end on April .Last week The Mirror told how the cost of living crisis had created a home ownership-obsessed generation, that has wholly dferent objectives when it comes to buying their first home. A new social study from the property concierge , Moveable showed leveraging capital for property had become the top priority for buyers. But when it comes to owning bricks and mortar, investing in developments is now trumping dwelling. The research revealed a younger and more property-savvy generation of homebuyers, driving the property market. news uk-news i-spent--asda-smart-"Cost of Living: Reporter impressed by Asda Smart Price dealsByEmma Gill:,  Apr |comments The weekly supermarket shop can be a stressful endeavour, especially during these times of economic hardship for many families. The cost of living crisis is hitting Brits hard and tough decisions are having to be made every day.Energy bills and council tax is going up, as is the cost of fuel, and it means seeking out a bargain where you can.As such, shoppers are trying to cut back wherever possible, reports the Manchester Evening News.For many that means changing shopping habits and paying a lot more attention to whataposs being spent at the supermarket.Have you found any cost-saving hacks  Let us know at webnews@mirror While some people may turn their noses up at budget ranges, thereaposs a reason why the likes of Asda Smart Price and Morrisons Savers have become so popular. Itaposs because they offer decent products at great value for money. Same goes for the likes of budget retailers Aldi and Lidl. Our Cost of Living team of experts are here to help YOU through a very dficult year. Theyaposll be bringing you the latest money news stories and also providing specialist advice. Whether itaposs rocketing energy bills, the cost of the weekly shop or increased taxes, our team will be with you all the way. Every Thursday at pm they will take part in a Facebook Live event to answer your questions and offer their advice. Visit facebook dailymirror live to watch. You canabout our team of experts here. If you have a question - or want to share your story - please get in touch by emailing webnews@mirror. Admittedly some of it is not to everyoneaposs taste - you canapost get the lowest fat versions of meat and cheese, for example. But when needs must, the priority is putting food on the table and doing it the cheapest and healthiest way you can. And itaposs easy to overlook the essentials you buy week-in week-out. If you bought these basic Smart Price versions, they would make little dference to the overall taste of your meals but a massive dference to your bank balance. Thataposs not to mention the whopping bags of potatoes, .kg for p, and carrots, .kg for p, from its budget fruit, veg and meat range.  Those prices are pretty much on a par with Aldiaposs Everyday Essentials wonky veg and we all know how much people rave about those. You can save on meat too, with chicken breasts costing around £. for a large g pack and bacon £. for g. There was no p Smart Price bread in stock, but Asdaaposs own comes in at a very reasonable p for an g loaf and is one thing that is worth spending those extra pennies on. But there are plenty more products where savings can be made,youaposre willing to sacrice your fancy labels. Do you really care that much about your brand of loo roll or cleaner to splash out on something thataposs quite literally going down the toilet   My haul of products from Asdaaposs budget ranges cost me just over £ and Iaposll be honest, it made me feel a bit of a fool. A fool for poo-pooing these budget brands for so many years without considering which items I could so easily swap into my weekly shop without sacricing quality or taste. From now on, itaposll be the p toilet cleaner going down the pan and not my hard earned cash. Itaposs all about playing it Smart. title: martin lewis fans share tips
story: Martin Lewis fans share tips on cooking a family meal for p with just one potConcerned by the rising cost of living, Martin Lewis and his Money Saving Expertteam asked their social media followers for their best tips to help Brits who are struggling team asked their followers for tips to help people who are struggling financially amid the cost of living crisis" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Irish-stew-in-a-slow-cooker-pot.jpg" width"" "" Martin Lewis and his Money Saving Expertteam asked their followers for tips to help people who are struggling financially amid the cost of living crisis Image: Getty Images iStockphotoByJenna ThompsonRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Apr  team asked their social media followers for their best tips to help Brits who are struggling" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _Irish-stew-in-a-slow-cooker-pot.jpg" data-tracking"facebook|share|top" team asked their social media followers for their best tips to help Brits who are struggling" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _Irish-stew-in-a-slow-cooker-pot.jpg" data-tracking"twitter|share|top" team asked their social media followers for their best tips to help Brits who are struggling" data-content-image"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES s _Irish-stew-in-a-slow-cooker-pot.jpg" data-tracking"whatsapp|share|top"|commentsMartin Lewis fans have been sharing tips on how struggling families can slash the cost of family meals. Martin Lewis and his Money Saving Expertteam asked social media followers for their best tips to help people who are suffering amid the c ost-of-living crisis. The team has compiled the Cost of Living Survival Guide to help Brits weather the price hikes, Hull Live reports.Families are expected to feel the sting this month as energy bills and National Insurance are increased. Council tax, fuel prices and food are also going up, leading to more people feeling the pinch. Introducing his teamaposs tips, Martin Lewis wrote: For some there is sadly no route to cut expenditure below income that fix will need political intervention.  For others, we need a collective endeavour, to work together to take financial pressures off where we can. And that is partly behind this guide. He explained the team had received thousands of replies from people with clever ideas about how to cut household expenditure. Martin described the response - which included more than , replies to his tweet alone - as overwhelming and uplting. One of the tips was to invest in a slow cooker to batch cook meals for all the family. They are available from Asda for as little as £. The Money Saving Expert team said batch cooking creates less food waste and reduces the likelihood of spending extra cash on takeaways.  One follower said they are apossaving a fortuneapos by using theirs more and more. Sharron Quaile wrote: A chef was on TV recently telling us all to get a slow cooker, as it costs p to cook a meal overnight. Made a cracking chilli the other night, gave my neighbour a portionand thereaposs one portion in the freezer. A user under the name of Living in Hope wrote: Iaposm using my slow cooker more and more these days to batch cook delicious soups, curries, stews etc then I freeze it in recycled takeaway containers. Saves a fortune all round. They added it did not cost much to invest in. It’s a standard sized one, only cost me about £ - very simple, no whistles or bells, but does the job, they wrote. The MSE guide also says that using a microwave is generally cheaper than an oven. It states a jacket potato would be more than  per cent cheaper to cook in the microwave rather than the oven. title: mum who didnt realise how
story: Mum who didnt realise how loved she was took her own le in her kitchenIndre Razutyte, from Pontefract, West Yorkshire, who was "loved by everyone she met", was found dead in her garage on March , Wakefield Coroners Court was toldIndre Razutyte and her two-year-old daughter Image: GoFundMeByJasmine Norden:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr A mother who was loved by everyone she met took her own le at home, an inquest heard. Indre Razutyte, , was found unresponsive in her kitchen by her ex-partner on March .CPR was performed at the home in Pontefract, West Yorkshire, but Indre was declared dead. Suicide notes were found in the kitchen, Yorkshire Live reports.Indre leaves behind a two-year-old daughter. Wakefield Coroneraposs Court heard on Friday that Indre was much loved by her colleagues at small transport firm Centika Logistics. The mother was a transport manager there, and made such an impression on me immediately. Colleague Wayne Kearns, who joined the company in September last year, said: Weaposre a small company, more like a family. Because of that I worked closely with Indre and we became good friends. She was like a little sister to me.  She did used to sometimes talk about the issues she was facing, but it was such a shock to hear about her death and so heartbreaking. Weaposd spoken the day before when she was working from home. That day me and the manager had been messaging her because she hadnapost come in. Losing Indre has felt like losing a member of the family. She was one of the nicest and kindest people I have ever met, she would help anybody. She was so nice, and I donapost think she realised how lovely a person she was and how loved she was. I think she was worried about being left on her own. Indreaposs heartbroken family live in Lithuania, and are hoping to repatriate her home for a funeral there.Wayne and some of Indreaposs other colleagues have set up a GoFundMe page to help them pay for the costs of getting Indre home.As of April , the page is at £,. Any money left over from the fundraising will be put into a trust fund for Indreaposs two-year-old daughter. When we had drivers at the company who were having a bad day and would snap at anyone , Indre was the only one who could calm them down. Customers would ask for her specically. She could relate to anybody and I donapost think she realised how great she was, Wayne added. She was really good at her job and just at talking to people. We always had a laugh in the office together. If she was feeling down Iaposd go to Morrisons and get us cake. Indre made such a big impact on me straight away. I wish I couldaposve had the time to get to know her even better. The full inquest has been adjourned to a later date. Assistant coroner John Hobson did recount in brief the events that preceded Indreaposs death being recorded.The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. title: my dog saved life became
story: My dog saved my le when I became homeless but I cant get a home because of himMick, , who lives on the streets of London with his -year-old Staffordshire Bull Terrier Benson, was made homeless after losing his job and then his home in Mick and his pet pooch Benson Image: StreetVetByTara CobhamRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Apr |comments A homeless man canapost secure a place to live because hostels wonapost take him in with the dog that saved his le. Mick lost his job and then his home before ending up on the streets of London with his Staffordshire Bull Terrier, Benson, in . He told MyLondon : “Without him, I think I would have gone under.And he wouldn’t be able to survive without me, simply because of our bond. We’re together  . He understands me, I understand him. He’s the only thing I put my trust into and he’s never let me down.” But because of his beloved -year-old pooch, the Londoner has struggled for seven years to get housing. Their bond has only grown stronger over the years since Mick, who asked to only be called his first name, adopted Benson from his previous owner, who couldnapost take care of him anymore, at -months-old.  “How could I say no to him ” said the Londoner lovingly. “When he was three, I lost my job, then couldn’t afford my rent so lost my property, and ended up on the streets. I wrestled with my conscience over whether it was right to keep him - but he’s been through so much upheaval, I couldn’t not.”The duo appeared on the hit ITV show Paul OaposGrady: For the Love of Dogs and are known in their local area, around Liverpool Street and Hackney, with people like the shop owners, taxi drivers and station owners all keeping an eye on Benson.“I’m always conscious of him - that people might try and take him, said the -year-old, Rest and sleep is the hardest thing on the streets - you’re sleeping with one eye open.” He said: “Everything has to be centred around him and I have to worry about what’s going to happen to him. And then you can’t take him to certain services.”This includes many accommodation options for those who are experiencing homelessness. In fact, only around  percent of hostels in the UK are pet friendly, according toStreetVet , a charity working to increase this statistic and delivering free veterinary care to the pets of people experiencing homelessness around the country. According to StreetVet, to apply for housing benefits, some form of address is required. A hostel address is usually used for this, but as Mick said he struggles to get into hostels with Benson, he is unable to even get started with the benefits process. He also noted that many housing associations will not accept dogs. “You get accused of making yourself intentionally homeless so they don’t take any responsibility,” he said. “I’ve been trying to get housed for seven years. You get the choice between your room and your pet - that’s not a choice. They’re not acknowledging the support of Benson as important in my le, despite my health conditions.” Mick suffers with anxiety and depression, which he said contributed to losing his job. He believes he would have turned to drink and drugsit had not been for Benson. He said: “He’s my escape and gives me something to focus on. He’s a mainstay in my le and keeps me grounded. If he’s not around me, I feel lost - I feel secure when I’m with him. He’s not so much for protection as he is for comfort. You look at him and think, ‘It ain’t all bad - Iaposve got him. As long as I’ve got him, I’m okayapos. He added: “When you’re on the street, so many things can happen. If I start getting heated with someone, he can bring me back down. He reminds me that there are more important things. If anything would happen to me, then what would happen to him  If anything happened to him, then that would kill me, andanything happened to me then that would kill him - that’s it.” Mick claims that Bensonaposs role in apossaving his leapos has not been taken into consideration in his attempts to find a home for the both of them. Even during the pandemic, he claims he was not offered a room with his dog. He added: “I’d sooner take the risk on the street with my boy than be separated from him - simple. He also says knows some people have only just had their pets ed to them.He said: “The authorities didn’t grasp the bond between man and dog.” Founder of StreetVet Jade Statt explained that some places in the UK were better than others at housing owners with their pets - but the resounding feedback from her clients was that a poor effort was made in London. “They didn’t realise that people who have pets and are homeless are much less likely to engage in antisocial behaviour because that would end up in them being separated from their dog. You have a reason, a role, a responsibility,” said Jade. She added: “Because that dog was everything to them”. Summing up his dreams for the future, Mick said: “My dream is to have somewhere to call home - a self-contained property where me and Benson can live out our days. title: new details operation london bridge
story: New details of Operation London Bridge for when Queen dies revealed after protocol panicA huge operation will take place when the Queen dies, with a Day of National Mourning, a pause on all Government work and other marks of respect to the MonarchOperation London Bridge will come into force when the Queen dies Image: Getty ImagesByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Apr |commentsNew details about how churches across the UK will mark their respects when the Queen dies have been revealed.Operation London Bridge, the plan for the days following the Monarchaposs passing, will see the country enter a period of official mourning.Royal Household to the Central Council of Church Bell Ringers will request that religious buildings ring their bells with muffles in order to create a more solemn sound. However many churches have now realised their leather muffles are rotten as they have not been used since King George VIaposs death  years ago.As a result, leatherworkers have been inundated with orders as churches rush to ensure theyaposre ready for the sad day, reports the Mail on Sunday. Sales have reportedly doubled in the past few months. Vicki Chapman, from the Central Council of Church Bell Ringers, told the newspaper that adding the muffle turns the bellsapos normal dong, dong, dong into more of a thudding sound. She said: We have spent a lot of time talking to the Royal Household and Lambeth Palace about the day the monarch passes, which we hope will not be any time soon. It is important as it is about paying due reverence to the service of the monarch and commemorating her le.”  Last year full details of Operation London Bridge were leaked, giving a full day-to-day run down of what will happen when the Queen passes away. The day will be known as D Day, with the days following called D Day plus the number of days that have passed. For example the second day will be D Day Plus One. Prince Charles - who will become King upon his motheraposs passing - will address the nation on the day of her death, while the Prime Minister will be the first government member to issue a statement. Government departments have been instructed to have flags at half mast within  minutes of the announcement, with Cabinet members set to be called with the sad news and urged to show discretion.  The Queen will be buried  days after she dies, it is expected, and Charles will embark on a tour of the UK before the burial is held. The sovereignaposs coffin will lie in state for three days at the Houses of Parliament, with authorities anticipating hundreds of thousands of people to descend on London - sparking fears over gridlock, policing and even food shortages. Any other Parliamentary business is set to be suspended for  days, it is reported. The day of the funeral will be a Day of National Mourning, but employers will not be compelled to give staff a day off. The service will take place at Westminster Abbey, and a two minute silence will be held across the UK at noon. A committal service will be held at St Georgeaposs Chapel, which is at Windsor Castle, where the Queen will be buried at King George VI Memorial Chapel. title: primary school kids taught how
story: Exclusive: Primary school kids taught how to spot cannabis gummies that look like sweetsSweets have been banned from some schools after drug dealers hid intoxicants in treats that look like Haribo. Last month, law student Damilola Olakanmi, , died after eating a suspected cannabis gummyKids are being taught how to spot drug sweets Image: Getty ImagesByAmy SharpeNews Reporter:,  Apr Schools are teaching primary kids about deadly cannabis “gummies” which look like harmless sweets. Some have banned candy altogether over reports of pushers selling drugs disguised as brands like Haribo. They contain synthetic cannabis, sometimes known as spice, which can cause hallucinations, paranoia and even death. Last month, law student Damilola Olakanmi, , died after eating a suspected cannabis gummy. She had ordered them on a phone app to be delivered to her home in Ilford, East London, the same day. Police have visited one school, Boundary Primary in Blackpool, to show pupils aged  and  the dference between real sweets and dodgy ones. Another school has banned youngsters from bringing any confectionary on site after Northumbria Police reports that gummies are being sold for as little as £. on Snapchat.Parents of children at Farringdon Community Academy in Sunderland have been warned that the drugs “look like normal packets of sweets but may have odd spellings and dferent fonts”. All Saints School in York also warned that sweets packaged to resemble brands like Haribo, Nerds and Millions are “of particular concern.” Officers seized £, of edible cannabis disguised as Dairy Milk and Milky Bars in Wakefield, West Yorks, in March. Police say county lines gangs use sweets to lure kids into dealing. Last week forces in the east of England said there were almost  reports of them being found over six months in . title: prince george taking after prince
story: Prince George taking after Prince William and Kate with particular sporting skillIt looks like Prince George is taking after his parents, Prince William and Kate Middleton, in more ways than one - including learning a particular sporting skillPrince George is set to take after his parents Image: PAByEmma RosemurgeyAudience WriterRebecca Russell:,  Apr |commentsPrince William and Kate recently ed from a royal tour of the Caribbean in celebration of the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee, where they engaged in a number of activities from bobsleighing in Jamaica to scuba ing in Belize.The couple are always keen to have a go at new activities but scuba ing is nothing new to the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, with Wills taking on the presidency of the British Sub-Aqua Clubin .The Duke followed in the footsteps of his father, Prince Charles, and his grandfather, the late Prince Philip, who both previously held the title - and it looks like Prince George is set to follow suit. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Speaking to BSAC members at the time, William said it was a great honour to take on the role from his father and that he hoped one day George - who was just a baby at the time - would also follow in his footsteps. I hope that one day my son George might follow in our footsteps, he said. For the moment bath time is quite painful, but I imagine as he gets a little bit older, donning a mask and snorkel might calm him down. And, it seems as though George is doing exactly that, with rumours suggesting he is preparing to head to Lambrook school in September, where heaposll benefit from a whole host of extracurricular activities, including scuba ing. The school is reported to cost an eyewatering £, and £, per term, however it boasts everything from a nine-hole golf course, a polo field, beehives, fencing and a mini Masterchef club.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. news uk-news prince-philips-poignant-last-words-"Prince Charles recalls his last phone call with Prince PhilipByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Apr |commentsWhen Prince Philip died last year, those closest to him spoke fondly of his humour and quick wit. As he saw out his final, peaceful days at Windsor Castle before he passed away aged , he seemingly retained his sense of fun. And, true to form, the -year-old couldnapost resist one last one wisecrack while speaking to his eldest son Prince Charles, the day before he died. In a documentary celebrating the le of his father, Charles recalled the last conversation he had over the phone with Philip just hours before his death.In an intimate interview for a BBC film, the Prince of Wales described how he tentatively broached the subject of Philipaposs upcoming th birthday and suggested a party, knowing it was something his dad was not keen on. And Charles revealed how Philipaposs response left him with one last happy memory of his dadaposs cheeky nature. He recalled he told the late Duke of Edinburgh that the family had been talking about his th birthday. Knowing his father was slightly hard of hearing, Charles then repeated himself more loudly, emphasising: aposWeaposre talking about your birthday! And whether thereaposs going to be a reception!apos  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up To which Charles said Philip replied sharply, without missing a beat: Well, Iaposve got to be alive for it, havenapost I  Charles then said: I told him aposI knew youaposd say that!apos and added that it was a happy memory.  Yesterday marked exactly one year since Philipaposs sad death, with the Royal Family marking the day in private. It is believed that his beloved we the Queen spent the anniversary at Windsor Castle. It came as the naval unorm worn by Philip along with his admiral’s cap went on display for the first time on the first anniversary of his death. The items are part of an exhibition at the National Museum of the Royal Navyin Portsmouth Historic Dockyard looking at the Queen’s close links to the Navy as part of celebrations for her Platinum Jubilee.As well as being the daughter and granddaughter of monarchs who served in the Navy, the Queen became an officer’s we when she married Philip.The exhibition also includes photographs depicting the Queen’s many engagements as ceremonial head of the Royal Navy. title: tornado strikes wales winds strong
story: Tornado strikes Wales with winds so strong ewe and her lambs carried into the airThe extreme weather struck Gogarth Hall Farm in Pennal - the Tornado and Storm Research Organisation said it believes that the damage was caused by a T tornadoDamage to Gogarth Hall Farm in Pennal Image: PAByTom DavidsonAssistant news editor:,  Apr |commentsStrong winds that caused at least £, of damage to a farm in North Wales have been confirmed as a tornado, according to experts.The extreme weather struck Gogarth Hall Farm in Pennal on Wednesday, uprooting trees and lting a ewe and lambs into the air.The Tornado and Storm Research Organisation said it had investigated the site and believed that the damage was caused by a T tornado. Investigator John Mason said objects had spun around before falling to the ground. The tornado was confirmed as there was plenty of evidence of objects being airborne and spinning around the circulation before falling to the ground, he said.  He added that he believed it had a strength of between mph-mph. Deilwen Breese, owner of Gogarth Hall Farm, said she was away from the farm when she received a phone call telling her to come home. Ms Breese told the PA news agency she did not realise the scale of the damage until she got back. I thought it was just that part of the roof had gone, she said. But oh my god, when I came home I could not believe it. Ms Breese said she was still in shock from the incident. The devastation, it was heartbreaking, she said. I am still in shock, really. Ms Breese added: Trees had been lted from their roots. If they hadnapost been lted they had just been tarnished. We have lost hundreds of trees. The winds were so strong that a ewe and its lambs were lted into the air. Ms Breese said: It took a ewe out through the bay of a shed, and it picked up the little lambs. She said the lambs were fine, but the ewe was gone. Ms Breese said that the damage to the roof was about £,. When I got to the farm I could see the damage to the roof, itaposs about £, worth of damage on the roof. She said a group of  local volunteers were now helping her clear the devastation. However, Ms Breese feels that the farm will not be the same. She said: Itaposs going to take months, it will never get back, not in my letime. It will never come back to what it was. news uk-news uks-biggest-family-radfords-dodge-"The Radfords share their plans to build their own homeByFatima Aziz:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |commentsMembers of the UKaposs biggest family successfully navigated through chaos at Manchester Airport for an Easter getaway. Sixteen members of the Radford clan reached Florida despite previous worries of getting the brood through the long delays. Mum Sue and dad Noel successfully left their Morecambe home to jet off to a sunnier Florida where the kids can be seen having a blast as Disney World.Posting on Instagram Sue provided snippets of the journey including some brief shots in the airport, Lancashire Live reports.Clips show the kids running along the airport travellators, looking out at the window to the their plane and then finally, seated and on their way to the Easter holiday. But it wasnapost smooth sailing getting there. In a recent vlog, Sue spoke from the families home in Morecambe about the checklist of things needed to be done before getting on the plane. One of those tasks included getting a Covid test for everyone.  Speaking to fans in their aposmost tense vlog everapos, Sue explained that the day before they left for the airport they would have to take  Covid tests in appointment slots with an online witness. The four appointments included four family members at a time and just one negative test could write off the highly anticipated holiday for the entire family. Sue said: Iaposm hoping, fingers crossed, that everybody is negative. I canapost even begin to tell you how nervous I am about these tests. I did not sleep very well last night because obviouslysomeone is positive, we canapost go and weaposll have to rearrange it.I keep thinking it wonapost be the end of the worldwe do have to rearrange it, I think the situation with Manchester Airport at the minute is an absolute nightmare andIaposm honest, Iaposm not keen on doing that because I think itaposs taking two and a half, three hours, to get through security, checking-in as well is taking about an hour. Obviously when youaposve got sixteen of us, you can well double that, so probably about five hours for us by that time we probably would have missed our flight.  She continued: Iaposm not wanting to go through that, I must admit. So Iaposm thinking, it wonapost be the end of the worldone of us does test positive, we can just rearrange it for later in the year but obviously the kids will be absolutely devastated. But no signs of those fears affecting the trip were shown in the short but sweet video she posted. The only mention of the airport madness was in the comments as one person said: Oh Iaposm over the moon you are there and safe! The news is horrible re Manchester airport. Sue replied: It really is itaposs awful for all the staff on the frontline getting all the abuse. The Radfords continue to document their Easter break on Instagram with talk of a Disneyland vlog coming up too. title: uk weather forecast britain hotter
story: UK weather forecast: Britain to be hotter than Ibiza with C Easter sizzler on its wayThe Met Office says Britain will see warmer weather from the start of the week and we could even see C in the southeast into the Easter weekendTemperatures are expected to soar for Easter Image: Amer Ghazzal REX ShutterstockByGraeme MurrayNathan Rao:,  Apr Updated:,  Apr |commentsBritain is to be hotter than Ibiza as the sun comes out for a C Easter sizzler, forecasters believe. Temperatures will soar this week as bitter winds and snow give way to a balmy apostropicalapos blast.Warm winds will flood into Britain steered around high pressure similar to the driver of the march mini heatwave. Met Office weather meteorologist Aidan McGivern said: Warmer weather is on the way for the start of the week, and we could even see C in the southeast.The general trend is for it to turn warmer with higher pressure increasingly likely through the week and into the following week. There is still the chance of some rain mainly in the west. Stubborn rainfall threatens to dampen spirits in Scotland and north-western Britain, he added. He said: Into Monday, low pressure becomes more and more erratic, but it looks likely that northern and western parts of the UK that bear the brunt of any wetter weather. Low pressure is slowly progressing from the west bringing some rain in on Sunday, most likely in north-west of the UK, western Scotland, western England and north Wales  Cold air remains in the far north with the potential for snowthat rain mixes with cold air as it approaches from the west. However, forecasters agree the UK is about to warm up with a F scorcher prompting bookmaker Ladbrokes to slash the odds to - on a record hot Easter. Spokesman Alex Apati said: At last it looks as though Brits will have something to smile about on the weather front, with a record-breaking Easter scorcher potentially on the cards.  Jim Dale, meteorologist for British Weather Services, said: The trend is for temperatures to rise next week. If things play out, we could be looking at C or C in the south over Easter. Warm weather comes with a warning for hay-fever sufferers with tree pollen levels predicted to soar next week. Airborne allergens expert Max Wiseberg said: The start of the tree pollen season has been slow, with the poor weather so far most of this spring.  But it looks asthe season could start in earnest with high pollen counts forecast across the South and East of England on Monday. Britain could be about to turn hotter than Ibiza with temperatures on the Balearic Island to top C next week.Met Office meteorologist Dan Stroud said: It is all change as we go into Monday.Warmer conditions will be brought by tropical maritime air coming in from the south west.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON WeatherMet OfficeHeatwave" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: woman discovered shed won 300000
story: Woman discovered shed won £, from scratchcard sitting in doctors waiting roomFormer lollipop lady Caroline Walsh found out she had scooped £, while she sat in the waiting room having bought a scratchcard on her way to the doctors surgeryCaroline Walsh couldnt believe it when she had found out she had wonByMatt Strudwick:,  Apr |comments A mum found out she had won a lottery jackpot of £, as she sat in the waiting room at her doctoraposs surgery.Ex-lollipop lady Caroline Walsh bought a scratchcard on her way to her GP. She decided to scratch it off as she sat and waited for her appointment and found out she had scooped £,. The -year-old managed to withhold her excitement and didnapost even tell her doctor about the win as the loving mum wanted her two sons to be the first to find out.Thank goodness the doctor didnapost take my blood pressure in the appointment, it would have been through the roof, she said.I wouldnapost have been able to tell her what was causing it because I wanted my sons to be the first to know.  I spoke to my sons as soon as I got out of the surgery and they couldnapost believe it! Weaposre all in shock. They are both grown up and have children of their own, so the money will make such a dference to all of us. The lottery win comes a year since Carolineaposs husband of  years, Mike, died of cancer. The loved-up couple regularly played the National Lottery together, and the widow said Mike would have loved all of this. Mike and I always used to play the National Lottery together and talk about what weaposd dowe won, she said. He would have loved all of this. He always said he wanted us to move to Spainwe won but, for now, I think heaposll be happy knowing that Iaposm going to be taken care of. Mikeaposs death coincided with a run of rotten luck. The loss of her husband caused Caroline to have a lupus attack, and while spending six weeks in hospital her bungalow home flooded. She was forced to retire as a lollipop lady last year due to ill health after  years in the role. But now the family have some good news to celebrate and Caroline said sheaposs already bought some treats for her grandchildren. She said: Iaposm going to put some money aside for all of them. My husband and I have had a caravan for years in Brean Sands in Somerset. We had such a lovely community of friends there and Iaposm looking forward to going back to celebrate in a place where I have such happy memories. “Last year was awful but things are definitely improving, she added. The first thing I’m going to do is transform my garden. I want to make it into a space that’s easy to manage and somewhere I can enjoy when the sun shines. Her eldest son Chris, , is a hospital ward manager and is hoping to spend the money on a family holiday. He said: I couldnapost believe it when my mum called, I was absolutely ecstatic. £, is an amazing amount of money and I canapost wait to put it towards a family holiday and plenty of treats for my partner and our children. The Walsh family bought their winning Super s Scratchcard from Premier Express, Windsor Road, Pontypool.
